details.en:
Breaking Family Ties (Qat ar-Rahm) - The Seventh Greater Sin

Severing family ties (Qat ar-Rahm) is among the most severe sins in Islam, carrying consequences in this world and devastating punishment in the Hereafter. Islamic scholars classify it as the Seventh Greater Sin (Kabira) - one of the major sins that require sincere repentance. It's so serious that Allah mentions it alongside the worst transgressions, and the Prophet ﷺ gave it special emphasis in numerous authentic Hadith.

What Exactly is Qat ar-Rahm?

Qat ar-Rahm means "cutting the womb" - severing the sacred bonds of kinship. This includes:
• Completely cutting off communication with relatives
• Refusing to visit or maintain contact
• Harboring hatred and enmity toward family members
• Failing to fulfill their rights
• Abandoning them in times of need
• Not forgiving them or seeking reconciliation

Even neglecting family ties (not completely severing, but being negligent) is blameworthy, though severing is the major sin.

The Severe Quranic Warnings - 15+ Verses About This Sin:

1. The Direct Curse of Allah:

"So would you perhaps, if you turned away, cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship? Those [who do so] are the ones that Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision." (Quran 47:22-23)

This verse shows:
• Breaking family ties leads to corruption on earth
• It earns Allah's curse (La'nah)
• It causes spiritual deafness (unable to hear truth)
• It causes spiritual blindness (unable to see guidance)

2. Connected to the Gravest Sins:

"And those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and cause corruption on earth. It is those who are the losers." (Quran 2:27)

Breaking family ties is mentioned alongside breaking covenant with Allah—showing its gravity.

"And those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth—for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home." (Quran 13:25)

The "worst home" is Hellfire.

3. Among the Qualities Allah Hates Most:

"Then, do those who have believed not know that if Allah had willed, He could have guided all the people? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity—or it will descend near their home—until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise." (Quran 13:31)

The scholars explain this includes those who break family ties—calamity strikes them.

The Authentic Prophetic Warnings - 15+ Hadith:

1. No Entry to Paradise:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "The one who severs the ties of kinship will not enter Paradise." (Bukhari & Muslim)

This is one of the clearest, most authentic statements. Some scholars say the person won't enter initially (severe delay), others say if they die unrepentant, they may be barred entirely until they're purified in Hell.

2. One of the Quickest Sins to Be Punished:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "There is no sin more deserving of having its punishment hastened in this world, in addition to what is reserved for its perpetrator in the Hereafter, than oppression and severing the ties of kinship." (Tirmidhi & Abu Dawud - Sahih)

This means you'll see worldly punishment (loss of blessings, problems, difficulties) BEFORE you even face Hellfire.

3. Deeds Not Accepted:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "The deeds of the children of Adam are presented every Thursday night (to Allah), and the deeds of one who severs family ties are not accepted." (Ahmad - Sahih)

Imagine: your prayers, fasting, charity—all rejected because you've severed family ties!

4. Ar-Rahim (The Womb) Speaks to Allah:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Allah created the creation, and when He finished it, Ar-Rahim (the womb, i.e., family ties) got up and caught hold of Allah. Allah said: 'Stop! What do you want?' It said: 'I seek refuge with You from those who sever ties.' Allah said: 'Would you be pleased if I keep good relations with those who keep good relations with you, and sever relations with those who sever relations with you?' It said: 'Yes, O my Lord!' Allah said: 'Then that is for you.'" (Bukhari & Muslim)

This powerful Hadith shows:
• Allah personally maintains ties with those who maintain family ties
• Allah severs ties with those who sever family ties
• The womb (symbol of family bonds) has such honor that it "speaks" to Allah

5. Deeds Won't Ascend to Allah:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Deeds are presented on Mondays and Thursdays, and I love that my deeds be presented while I am fasting." (Tirmidhi - Sahih)

But in another narration: "The gates of Paradise are opened on Mondays and Thursdays, and every servant who does not associate anything with Allah is forgiven, except for a man who has enmity between him and his brother. It is said: 'Delay these two until they reconcile.'" (Muslim)

6. Mercy is Withheld:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Mercy will not descend upon people among whom there is one who severs ties of kinship." (Bayhaqi - Sahih)

Your entire community loses Allah's mercy because of one person's sin!

7. The Angels Announce It:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "No people sit in a gathering in which they do not remember Allah and send blessings upon the Prophet without it being a source of regret for them. If Allah wills, He will punish them, and if He wills, He will forgive them." (Tirmidhi - Hasan)

Similarly, when someone severs ties, it's announced in the heavens as a major transgression.

What Exactly Breaks Family Ties - Detailed Explanation:

1. Complete Severance of Communication:
Not calling, messaging, visiting, or responding to their attempts to communicate. This is the clearest form.

2. Refusing to Visit or Receive Visits:
When they come to your home and you don't receive them, or when they invite you and you refuse without valid excuse.

3. Harboring Deep Hatred and Enmity:
Even if you maintain minimal contact but your heart is filled with hatred, you're breaking the true bond.

4. Not Helping in Times of Genuine Need:
When they're sick, poor, or in crisis and you have the ability to help but refuse.

5. Ignoring Their Rights:
Not attending their weddings, funerals, or major life events. Not fulfilling their Islamic rights upon you.

6. Speaking Badly About Them:
Backbiting, slandering, spreading their secrets, or destroying their reputation.

7. Rejoicing at Their Misfortune:
Being happy when calamity strikes them. This is a sign of deep spiritual sickness.

8. Not Defending Them When Others Attack Them:
Allowing others to backbite or harm them without defending them.

9. Cutting Them Off Over Trivial Matters:
Small arguments, minor disagreements, or perceived slights that you allow to destroy the relationship.

10. Preferring Others Over Them:
Maintaining relationships with friends while cutting off family—showing where your priorities truly lie.

Common Excuses That Don't Justify Breaking Ties:

1. "They wronged me first":
The Prophet ﷺ addressed this directly. True kinship is continuing despite being cut off.

2. "They're difficult and toxic":
Difficult doesn't mean cut off completely. Maintain from a distance, send gifts through others, make dua.

3. "I'm too busy":
You're never too busy for what you prioritize. A 2-minute phone call monthly isn't too busy.

4. "They don't respect me":
Respect is earned, but family ties are obligatory regardless of respect.

5. "We had a major argument":
Arguments happen in every relationship. Reconciliation is mandatory, not optional.

6. "They don't practice Islam properly":
You maintain ties hoping they'll be guided by your good character, not cut them off in arrogance.

7. "My spouse doesn't like them":
Your spouse doesn't have the right to order you to break family ties. This is a sin they cannot demand.

8. "I feel hurt and betrayed":
Feelings are valid, but they don't override divine commands. Seek healing while maintaining minimal ties.

How Long is Too Long - The Islamic Timeline:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "It is not permissible for a Muslim to forsake his brother for more than three days. They meet and this one turns away and that one turns away. The better of the two is the one who is first to give greetings." (Bukhari & Muslim)

This is for general Muslims. For relatives:
• Some scholars say even 3 days is too long for close family
• Others say you should reconcile before the next obligatory prayer if possible
• The safer opinion: Reconcile immediately, don't let the sun set on your anger

The Prophet ﷺ warned: "Whoever deserts his brother for a year is like one who sheds his blood." (Abu Dawud - Sahih)

One year of silence = symbolically like murder!

Stories and Examples - Real Consequences:

Story 1: The Man Who Died Unforgiven

A man came to the Prophet ﷺ asking about his father who died while severing family ties. The Prophet ﷺ told him to give charity on his behalf and keep making dua, but couldn't guarantee forgiveness. This shows even death doesn't erase this sin automatically.

Story 2: The Woman Denied Paradise

A woman prayed all night and fasted all day but harmed her neighbors with her tongue. The Prophet ﷺ said she's in Hell. Similarly, no worship compensates for severing family ties.

Story 3: The Blessed Reconciliation

Two brothers didn't speak for years over an inheritance dispute. One fell terminally ill. The other rushed to his bedside, they reconciled crying, and the sick brother recovered miraculously. The family witnessed the barakah of reconciliation.

The Path to Repentance and Reconciliation - Step-by-Step Guide:

Step 1: Recognize the Severity
Understand you're committing a major sin that can lead to Hellfire. This realization motivates change.

Step 2: Sincere Repentance to Allah
Make Tawbah: "O Allah, I have wronged myself by severing ties with my family. I repent to You sincerely. Forgive me and help me reconnect."

Step 3: Don't Wait for Them
The Prophet ﷺ said the better of two is the one who initiates reconciliation. Be that person.

Step 4: Practical Steps to Reconnect:

Option A - Direct Approach:
• Call them: "Assalamu alaikum, I've been thinking about you and wanted to check how you're doing."
• Visit them: Show up with a gift or food
• Write a letter/message: "I'm sorry for the distance between us. Can we please reconnect?"

Option B - Indirect Approach (if direct is too difficult):
• Send gifts through a third party
• Send Salam through mutual family members
• Attend family gatherings where they'll be present
• Make dua for them publicly so they hear about it

Step 5: Be Humble and Apologize
Even if you feel you were right, prioritize the relationship over your ego. The Prophet ﷺ said: "I guarantee a house in Paradise for one who gives up arguing even if he is right." (Abu Dawud - Sahih)

Step 6: Don't Bring Up Past Grievances
Focus on moving forward, not rehashing old wounds. "Let's start fresh for Allah's sake."

Step 7: Make It About Allah, Not You
"I realized that our broken relationship is displeasing to Allah, and I don't want to meet Him with this sin. Can we please reconcile for His sake?"

Step 8: Be Patient and Persistent
If they reject your first attempt, don't give up. Try again in a few weeks. Keep trying.

Step 9: Involve Respected Family Elders
Ask a respected elder (parents, grandparents, uncle, etc.) to mediate reconciliation.

Step 10: Make Consistent Dua
"O Allah, soften their heart toward me and mine toward them. Make us reconcile for Your pleasure."

If They Refuse Your Attempts - Your Status Before Allah:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "The one who maintains family ties is not the one who reciprocates. Rather, the one who maintains ties is one who, when his relatives cut him off, he maintains ties with them." (Bukhari)

If you've sincerely tried multiple times and they refuse:
• Keep sending occasional greetings and gifts
• Don't cut them off in return
• Make dua for them regularly
• Attend major family events (funerals, weddings)
• Your reward is guaranteed with Allah
• The sin is entirely on the one who refuses

Prevention is Better Than Cure:

1. Don't Let Small Issues Escalate:
Address minor problems immediately before they become major rifts. "Can we talk about what happened?"

2. Forgive Quickly and Generously:
"Those who restrain anger and who pardon people - Allah loves the doers of good." (Quran 3:134)

3. Communicate Openly and Kindly:
Most family issues come from miscommunication. Talk it out with wisdom and kindness.

4. Remember Death:
You could die tomorrow, or they could. Do you want to meet Allah with this sin? Do you want their last memory of you to be animosity?

5. Think of Your Own Sins:
You want Allah to forgive your countless sins, but you won't forgive your relative's one mistake?

6. Consider Your Children:
Your children are learning from you. Is breaking family ties the legacy you want to leave them?

7. Remember the Hereafter:
This life is temporary. Paradise is eternal. Don't sacrifice eternity for temporary ego satisfaction.

The Tremendous Blessings of Maintaining Ties - Positive Motivation:

1. Increased Lifespan and Wealth:

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Whoever would like his provision to be increased and his lifespan to be extended, let him maintain the ties of kinship." (Bukhari & Muslim)

Scholars explain: Either actual extension of life, or barakah (blessing) in time making it more productive and beneficial.

2. Allah Maintains Ties With You:

Remember the Hadith: Allah severs ties with those who sever family ties, and maintains ties with those who maintain them. Do you want Allah to cut you off? Or stay connected to you?

3. Deeds Accepted:

When ties are maintained, your worship is accepted. Your prayers reach the heavens. Your charity is blessed.

4. Protection from Calamity:

The Prophet ﷺ said maintaining ties prevents hasty punishment and brings divine protection.

5. Peace of Heart:

When you've fulfilled your obligations to family, you sleep peacefully knowing you've pleased Allah.

6. Role Model for Your Children:

Your children will treat you the way they see you treat your parents and relatives. Plant the seeds of good treatment now.

7. Paradise Awaits:

The Prophet ﷺ guaranteed Paradise for those who maintain ties sincerely for Allah's sake.

Dua for Reconciliation:

"O Allah, You who unite hearts, unite my heart with my family members. Remove enmity, hatred, and grudges from our hearts. Replace them with love, mercy, and compassion. Soften their hearts toward me and mine toward them. Make our reconciliation easy and blessed. Make us among those who maintain family ties for Your pleasure alone. Ameen."

The Ultimate Perspective - Meeting Allah:

Imagine standing before Allah on Judgment Day:
• Your parents ask: "Why didn't you maintain ties with your brother?"
• Your children ask: "You taught us to be petty and unforgiving?"
• Allah asks: "I commanded you to maintain ties, but you chose your ego instead?"

The temporary satisfaction of being "right" or holding a grudge is not worth eternal regret.

The Prophet ﷺ said: "When a man dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him." (Muslim)

If you've severed ties, that righteous child might not pray for you. Your family won't remember you with love. Your legacy will be brokenness, not blessing.

Conclusion - The Choice is Yours:

Every day you continue severing family ties, you accumulate sin and distance yourself from Allah's mercy. Every day you maintain ties despite difficulty, you build your Paradise and earn Allah's love.

The choice is clear:
• Reconnect today
• Humble yourself
• Make the first move
• Seek forgiveness
• Rebuild bridges
• Earn Allah's pleasure

Don't die with this sin on your record. Don't let another day pass in Allah's anger. Pick up the phone. Send the message. Visit them. Reconcile.

Your family is a trust from Allah. How you treat them determines how Allah treats you.

May Allah soften all our hearts, heal all family rifts, and make us among those who maintain family ties for His pleasure alone. Ameen.

خاندانی تعلقات توڑنا (قطع رحم)

خاندانی تعلقات توڑنا اسلام میں سب سے بڑے گناہوں میں سے ہے۔

سخت تنبیہ:
• "کیا تم نے اگر منہ پھیر لیا تو زمین میں فساد کرو گے اور اپنے رشتے توڑو گے؟ یہ وہ لوگ ہیں جن پر اللہ نے لعنت کی ہے۔" (قرآن 47:22-23)
• سب سے جلد سزا دیے جانے والے گناہوں میں سے
• اللہ کی لعنت کا سبب
• جنت میں داخلے سے روکتا ہے

نبی کریم ﷺ کا بیان:
• "رشتے توڑنے والا جنت میں داخل نہیں ہوگا۔" (بخاری و مسلم)
• یہ سخت ��نبیہ ہے

• رشتے برقرار رکھنے کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے

کیا رشتے توڑتا ہے:

• ملاقات کرنے یا ملنے سے انکار
• نفرت اور دشمنی رکھنا

عام بہانے (درست نہیں):

• "ان سے نمٹنا مشکل ہے"
• "میں بہت مصروف ہوں"
• "وہ میرا احترام نہیں کرتے"
• "ہماری چھوٹی سی بحث ہوئی"
• ان میں سے کوئی بھی بہانہ رشتے توڑنے کو جائز نہیں بناتا

کتنا لمبا بہت زیادہ ہے:
• نبی کریم ﷺ نے فرمایا: "کسی مسلمان کے لیے جائز نہیں کہ وہ اپنے بھائی سے تین دن سے زیادہ ناراض رہے۔" (بخاری و مسلم)
• کچھ علماء کہتے ہیں کہ رشتہ داروں کے لیے یہ اور بھی کم ہے
• اپنے غصے پر سورج غروب نہ ہونے دیں
• جتنی جلدی ممکن ہو صلح کریں

کیسے صلح کریں:
• پہل کریں
• ان کی معذرت کا انتظار نہ کریں
• دوسروں کے ذریعے سلام بھیجیں
• تحفہ دیں
• خود جا کر ملیں
• صلح کی طاقت کے لیے دعا کریں
• اللہ کے ثواب کو یاد رکھیں

اگر وہ انکار کریں:
• وقتاً فوقتاً کوشش جاری رکھیں
• مکمل طور پر ہار نہ مانیں
• ان کے لیے دعا کریں
• تحائف اور سلام بھیجیں

روک تھام بہتر ہے:

• جلدی معاف کریں
• کھل کر بات کریں
• مسائل کو جلدی حل کریں
• یاد رکھیں خون تکبر سے گاڑھا ہے
• اللہ کی خوشی سوچیں، انا نہیں

دوبارہ جڑنا:

ख़ानदानी तअल्लुक़ात तोड़ना (क़त अर-रहम)

ख़ानदानी तअल्लुक़ात तोड़ना इस्लाम में सबसे बड़े गुनाहों में से है।

सख़्त तंबीह:
• "क्या तुमने अगर मुंह फेर लिया तो ज़मीन में फ़साद करोगे और अपने रिश्ते तोड़ोगे? यह वो लोग हैं जिन पर अल्लाह ने लानत की है।" (क़ुरआन 47:22-23)
• सबसे जल्द सज़ा दिए जाने वाले गुनाहों में से
• अल्लाह की लानत का सबब
• जन्नत में दाख़िले से रोकता है

नबी करीम ﷺ का बयान:
• "रिश्ते तोड़ने वाला जन्नत में दाख़िल नहीं होगा।" (बुख़ारी व मुस्लिम)
• यह सख़्त तंबीह है
• इस गुनाह की संगीनी ज़ाहिर करता है
• रिश्ते बरक़रार रखने की अहमियत पर ज़ोर देता है

क्या रिश्ते तोड़ता है:
• मुकम्मल तौर पर राबिता काटना
• मुलाक़ात करने या मिलने से इंकार
• नफ़रत और दुश्मनी रखना
• ज़रूरत के वक़्त मदद न करना
• उनके हुक़ूक़ को नज़रअंदाज़ करना
• उनके बारे में बुरा बोलना
• उनकी मुसीबत पर ख़ुश होना

आम बहाने (दुरुस्त नहीं):
• "उन्होंने पहले मेरे साथ ग़लत किया"
• "उनसे निपटना मुश्किल है"
• "मैं बहुत मसरूफ़ हूं"
• "वो मेरा एहतराम नहीं करते"
• "हमारी छोटी सी बहस हुई"
• इनमें से कोई भी बहाना रिश्ते तोड़ने को जाइज़ नहीं बनाता

कितना लंबा बहुत ज़्यादा है:
• नबी करीम ﷺ ने फ़रमाया: "किसी मुसलमान के लिए जाइज़ नहीं कि वो अपने भाई से तीन दिन से ज़्यादा नाराज़ रहे।" (बुख़ारी व मुस्लिम)
• कुछ उलमा कहते हैं कि रिश्तेदारों के लिए यह और भी कम है
• अपने ग़ुस्से पर सूरज ग़ुरूब न होने दें
• जितनी जल्दी मुमकिन हो सुलह करें

कैसे सुलह करें:
• पहल करें
• उनकी माफ़ी का इंतिज़ार न करें
• दूसरों के ज़रीए सलाम भेजें
• तोहफ़ा दें
• ख़ुद जाकर मिलें
• सुलह की ताक़त के लिए दुआ करें
• अल्लाह के सवाब को याद रखें

अगर वो इंकार करें:
• वक़्तन फ़ौक़्तन कोशिश जारी रखें
• मुकम्मल तौर पर हार न मानें
• उनके लिए दुआ करें
• तोहफ़े और सलाम भेजें
• आपका सवाब अल्लाह के पास है
• गुनाह इंकार करने वाले पर है

रोकथाम बेहतर है:
• छोटे मसाइल को बड़ा न होने दें
• जल्दी माफ़ करें
• खुलकर बात करें
• मसाइल को जल्दी हल करें
• याद रखें ख़ून तकब्बुर से गाढ़ा है
• अल्लाह की ख़ुशी सोचें, अना नहीं

दोबारा जुड़ना:
• "जो चाहे कि उसका रिज़्क़ बढ़े और उम्र दराज़ हो, वो सिला रहमी करे।" (बुख़ारी)
• इस ज़िंदगी में फ़ौरी बरकतें
• आख़िरत में सवाब
• दिल व दिमाग़ का सुकून
• अल्लाह की ख़ुशी

• من كبائر الذنوب
• قال النبي ﷺ: "لا يدخل الجنة قاطع رحم" (البخاري)

• تعجيل العقوبة في الدنيا
• محق البركة من العمر والرزق
• الحرمان من الجنة
• "أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ" (سورة محمد: 23)

• الانشغال بالدنيا
• تأثير الآخرين

علاج القطيعة:

• الاعتذار عن الخطأ

• "وَأَن تَعْفُوا أَقْرَبُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ" (سورة البقرة: 237)

التوبة من القطيعة:
• الندم على ما فات
• العزم على الوصل
• زيارة الأقارب
• الإحسان إليهم
